section.heading: Introduction to XML
section.paragraph: XML (Extensible Markup Language) is a flexible and readable format used for data storage and transport. It is commonly used to structure data in a way that is easy to read and write both for humans and machines.

section.heading: Why Use XML?
section.paragraph: XML is platform-independent and allows different systems to communicate with one another. It's widely used in web services, RSS feeds, and data exchange protocols, making it essential in modern web development.
